title: Daniel Lock, Esq. F.a.s.
content:
Daniel Lock was an architect of some eminence. He retired from business with an ample fortune, lived in Surrey-street, and was buried in the chapel of Trinity College, Cambridge. This portrait was originally engraved by J. Mâ€™Ardell from a painting by Hogarth, and is classed among the productions of our artist that are of uncertain date.


Daniel Lock, Esq. F.A.S.
